intro: Alyssum elatius, commonly known as the tall alyssum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 100 centimeters, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Alyssum elatius is often found in meadows and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
